tracks.text: Rei sits naked in bed. She looks up at Takashi, who holds her.
Shizuka steps forward, oil dripping from her hands.
Her hands reach out. Takashi holds Rei.
Rei moans into Takashi's crotch as Shizuka rubs her naked body.

Text, High School of the DEAD
A dead man sits in a cage, carried by a forklift. Living stare through the bars.
Mr. Takagi draws an ornate sword.
A servant unlocks the cage.
The dead retainer runs forward. Mr. Takagi raises his sword. A baby bottle crashes to the ground. The crowd of refugees turns to a woman with a baby.
She bends down to pick up the glass pieces. She turns to look and freezes. The refugees gape.
Water runs down the fountain. The dead retainer's head floats in the fountain.
Blood spreads through the water.
The refugees stare up at him.
Takagi watches from the balcony. Her father approaches her mother. Her mother steps out of the way, and her father keeps walking. Her mother turns, and follows. Takagi frowns.
Hirano grimaces and runs away.
Takashi runs after him. Alice follows. Saiko sighs.
Takashi approaches a door and stops. He looks down.
Takagi walks through an idyllic garden, looking around.
She sees Saiko, kneeling by a pond.
The light through the trees dapples her skin. Takagi approaches from behind.
Saiko turns back.
She slowly stands.
Hirano clutches his guns.
Adults surround Hirano. Takashi approaches.
Wind blows the trees.
Takashi stares. Saiko and Takagi turn.
Mr. Takagi's boots stomp across the earth. His wife follows, her eyes down.
Hirano looks up at Takashi, tears in his eyes.
Alice hugs Hirano.
Saya Takagi's botts stomp across the earth. Soichiro turns.
Tears stream down Hirano's face.
Soichiro Takagi stares, brows furrowed, his face in shadow.
Yuriko Takagi stares, her face in shadow.
Saya Takagi stares determinedly, her face glistening in the sun.

Text, Preview
Text, Act 11, DEAD storm rising

Post-episode footnote: Originally, the word kimono literally meant 'a thing to wear', but in the last century, has come to refer to all traditional japanese clothes. It specifically calls to mind a formal robe with long sleeves held together by a sash called an obi. Both the robe and the obi can have several layers, depending on aesthetic and formality considerations. The robe itself usually has a colorful pattern. In the episode, Saiko wears a dark blue kimono with blocky strokes of purple and yellow. She is also wearing a white under robe called a nagajuban. Her obi sash is black with a yellow chrysanthemum print. A red cord called an obijime is tied around the obi to secure it so that it doesn't open. Under the obi is a green bustle called an obiage, which adds support so it doesn't slide up and down. Each piece alone is understated, with a little traditional, a little modern, a little subdued, a little vibrant. Collectively, it makes her looks refined and dignified, but in an unexpected way.
